intro: Ecclinusa cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's ecclinusa, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat and limited research, much about its ecological role and conservation status remains unknown.
